name: 'Bartlet For America' Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 3 | 10 Questions

questions.text: In this episode, who was being questioned for their part in the MS scandal?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	It was the day before Christmas Eve.

True.

	The reason Josh gave for wanting to help Leo was, "Because a guy's walking down the street and he falls into a hole." Josh is referring to the story Leo told him on Christmas Eve of 2000.

questions.text: Which meal did Leo say he loved?
questions.explanation:
Breakfast.

	Leo told Jordan, "I love orange juice."

questions.text: Who did Josh call a woman?
questions.explanation:
Mike.

	Josh called Mike Casper a woman because he sat behind the desk at the FBI instead of being out with his task force.

questions.text: In the flashback to the campaign, who popped a basketball into the store front window?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	Sam and Toby were popping the ball back and forth to each other. CJ got into it and started to pop it to Sam. The ball shot through the store front window in Manchester. Sam looked out through the hole and called for someone to get the ball.

questions.text: How many people were monitoring the phone call that the President made to Leo before the hearing began?
questions.explanation:
17.

	When the President told Leo to lie, Leo said over the phone, "Sir, this isn't a secure phone call. So I'd like to say to the 17 global intelligence networks listening just then, that he was kidding."

questions.text: Who said this? "Some of the stupidest criminals in the world live right here in America. I've always been proud of that."
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	He was referring to the kid that had been making Molotov cocktails to burn churches and confessed after he was pulled over for a broken tail light.

questions.text: Did Cliff talk the Chairman into postponing Leo's hearing?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Leo was about to be asked about an incident during the campaign when he got drunk in front of a future Congressman. Cliff postponed the hearing until after the Christmas break, but he really postponed because of the line of questioning that was about to be asked.

questions.text: Who did Leo say he loved?
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	Leo: "I love him so much."

questions.text: Who gave Leo a Bartlet For America napkin as a Christmas present?
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	Leo gave Jed a napkin with Bartlet For America written on it when he first approached Jed about running for President. When Leo returned to the office after the hearing, the President gave it to him with a bow on top. After the President left, Leo held the frame in his hand as tears came to his eyes.
